text: Q; for submitting answers, we will need to have one to many relationship in mongo. Should we just have a collection of answers within a question collection?
and users as well, since we need to know if the user voted or not
perhaps, a collection of answers in a question
there is a difference between a) possible answers and b) votes cast by users
yeah, so when a question is created its just a question
yep
and i guess that questions could store a collection of Answers which are made when a user actually votes on a voting page
yes. we would like to store votes made by students in a question
and answer will need to have a User as well
yes, it does
ok, makes sense

Hello to everyone, 

I would like to cite the comment made by the marker, in case you have not seen it: 

> “...but I couldn’t see your member’s contributions detail plus out 4 people which have committed to your GitHub[,] 2 members committed less than 50 lines of code and one member just 3 lines of code, all members should contribute towards your implementation!"

It is funny to see that markers have committed more towards our project than some developers. 

Come on, guys, how about getting some work done? It is difficult to be pulling all the weight.

I understand, I think it would be beneficial for us to all have an in person meeting tomorrow? It would be good to all get together and discuss where we are at as well as maybe assign more specific tasks so individuals are more productive
absolutely. I am down for that.
I think it will really help move things along and take some of the weight off you and yuriy
I am available all day until 4:00, not sure when is best for everyone else?
I am available after 11:30 till 1:30.
I just have a class at 1:30 also
i have classes 12:30 - 3:30

Yuriy, I took a look at your code. I know what’s wrong.

in front end, AngularJS can provide you with these action methods, one for each CRUD operation: 

```{ 'get':    {method:'GET'},
  'save':   {method:'POST'},
  'query':  {method:'GET', isArray:true},
  'remove': {method:'DELETE'},
  'delete': {method:'DELETE'} };```
You are calling your own method ```vote```
which is not going to work
yes i got to that point :simple_smile:
you’ll need to store the answer data in a question object on front end
then call save
or update
I believe update is better
alternatively, you can define your custom methods!
i see...its been a long day
ohh really?
yes
I’ll put it in the code and commit for you
one sec
